meanings.definition: Treat or regard (someone) with contempt or disrespect.
meanings.sent2: It is not right to degrade someone just because they are different.
meanings.sent3: The mean character in the story always tries to degrade the hero.
meanings.sent4: The harsh words used to degrade him were like arrows to his heart.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's actions aimed to degrade the student's confidence.

meanings.sent1: Leaving a car out in the sun can degrade its paint.
meanings.sent2: Over time, neglect can degrade the quality of a product.
meanings.sent3: The constant exposure to sunlight seemed to degrade the old painting.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fury seemed to degrade the once beautiful landscape.
meanings.sent5: The lack of maintenance will slowly degrade the building's structure.

meanings.sent1: The degraded soldier was determined to prove himself.
meanings.sent2: Being degraded to a lower position can be demoralizing.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meow sounded like a degraded version of a lion's roar.
meanings.sent4: The faded flag symbolized a once proud nation now degraded.
meanings.sent5: The degraded title no longer held the respect it once did.

meanings.sent1: If you don't take care of your teeth, they will degrade over time.
meanings.sent2: The metal fence started to degrade due to rust.
meanings.sent3: The old bridge began to degrade, creaking under the weight of the cars.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between the two friends slowly started to degrade.
meanings.sent5: The once vibrant colors of the painting began to degrade, fading into dullness.
